hive_class¶

class hive_class.hive[source]¶

Hive device control class This class controls hive devices. Currently, this only supports lights and groups of lights.

_getDevices(force=False)[source]¶

Gets a list of the devices

Gets a list of Hive devices. Currently, this only supports groups and lights. This should not be called directly from outside the class.

Parameters:
  • self – Instance of hive class
  • force – Boolean that forces a refresh of devices with the server
Raises:

ValueError – Nothing yet
Returns:

None
Return type:

None

See also

modules getLights(), getGroups()

_sendDeviceValue(light_id, payload)[source]¶
changeBrightness(light_id, brightness)[source]¶

Change the brightness of a light

Change the brightness of a light. If the value is below the minimum value of 100 or the maximum value of 0, the minimum or maximum value respectively will be used.

Parameters:
  • self – Instance of hive class
  • light_id – String representing ID of the light
  • brightness – Integer of the value to set brightness to (Min 0, Max 100)
Raises:

ValueError – Nothing yet
Returns:

Nothing yet
Return type:

None
changeColourTemperature(light_id, temperature)[source]¶

Change the colour temperature of a tunable light

Change the colour temperature of a tunable light. If the value is below the minimum value of 2700 or the maximum value of 6533, the minimum or maximum value respectively will be used.

Parameters:
  • self – Instance of hive class
  • light_id – String representing ID of the light
  • temperature – Integer to set temperature value to (Min 2700, Max 6533)
Raises:

ValueError – Nothing yet
Returns:

Nothing yet
Return type:

None
getApiKey()[source]¶

Obtains the Api key

Sends the username and password from the configuration file to obtain the api key.

Parameters:self – Instance of hive class
Raises:ValueError – Nothing yet
Returns:Api Key
Return type:str

toggleAllLights(status=2)[source]¶

Toggles all light devices

Toggles that status of all lights to either on, off, or the reverse of their current state.

Parameters:
  • self – Instance of hive class
  • status – Integer representing the state to set devices to 0 is off, 1 is on, 2 is the reverse of current state
Raises:

ValueError – Nothing yet
Returns:

Nothing yet
Return type:

None
toggleDevice(device_id)[source]¶

Toggles a device

Toggles that status of a device to either off if currently on, or on if currently off

This works with individual lights and groups.

Parameters:
  • self – Instance of hive class
  • device_id – String representing ID of the device
Raises:

hiveError – See hiveError for more info
Returns:

True if device has been turned on, False if device has been turned off. Returns None if neither of these actions has happened.
Return type:

Boolean or None
